p: Essential oils are the volatile concentrated hydrophobic liquids extracted from plants. Essential oils are extensive used in phytomedicine and aromatherapy and also in pharmaceuticals. They possess different biological functions like antibacterial, antifungal, antiviral, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, anticancer etc. [ 132]. Several reports described the effective antiviral activity of essential oils on influenza virus, herpes simplex virus etc. A mixture of essential oil and oleoresins from medicinal plants was also tested for coronavirus, bronchitis virus etc. [ 133]. Essential oil easily interacts with phospholipid bilayer of the cell membrane and it disrupt the viral envelope, thus starting their activity prior to host cell attachment.
